timeline.bodyText: The SQL State constants are not present in MariaDB client (or I wasn't able to find them).
timeline.author: hashhar

timeline.bodyText:
This test is overridden from AbstractTestDistributedQueries since the TPCH catalog in MemSQL has non-standard VARCHAR types. eg. orderpriority varchar(1) shows up as varchar(255) etc.
Should this test be skipped with a comment?
timeline.author: hashhar

timeline.bodyText: This test works for MySQL but fails for MemSQL. Manually running the generated SQL against MemSQL doesn't throw this error. Will need to dig deeper for this.
timeline.author: hashhar

timeline.bodyText: I opted to skip this test instead of modifying the test container since I don't think there's any point in making this test pass if it will actually fail in practice for most people.
timeline.author: hashhar

timeline.bodyText: Fixes #5263

replies.bodyText:
is the assumption about "memsql being case insensitive by default", correct?
can we have a ATQ / AbstractTestIntegrationSmokeTest entry validating connectors' correctnes across the board
replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: @findepi Yes. It's case insensitive by default.
replies.author: hashhar

timeline.bodyText: This seems to be due to MemSQL's FLOAT type having low precision rather than rounding errors.
timeline.author: hashhar

timeline.bodyText: CAST to JSON doesn't exist. There's a TO_JSON function but that parses strings into JSON values. ie. strings get converted into double quoted JSON strings. Passing strings that are valid JSON seem to get parsed into JSON during INSERT.
timeline.author: hashhar

replies.bodyText: Having comment is good, but this shouldn't be a TODO, because that's nor our problem.

timeline.author: losipiuk

replies.bodyText:
We can fire a query to test the easy cases (eg A = a) but it is possible for such checks to pass for ASCII characters but fail for unicode characters (eg. S = ß) depending on the collation used by the remote database.
I'm working on adding a smoke test to at-least verify that such-cases are caught in tests.
replies.author: hashhar

timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText: You did PUSHDOWN_AND_KEEP. Does it still fail?
timeline.author: findepi

replies.bodyText:
Yes.
Even with PUSHDOWN_AND_KEEP MemSQL sees the query as
-- Presto query
select row_id from test_data_mapping_smoke_varchar_1f0ab where value >= 'łąka for the win';
-- MemSQL query
SELECT `row_id` AS `row_id` FROM `tpch`.`test_data_mapping_smoke_varchar_1f0ab` WHERE ((`value` >= 'łąka for the win'))
Since the comparision now happens inside MemSQL and it defaults to a collation that is case-insensitive (and not UTF-8 friendly) and hence the tests fail. I was able to get the tests to pass by changing the collation of the connection (only affects literal values, not any values picked from tables) to binary.
